value.title: What’s Under The Hood Of This AI Revolution?
value.excerpt: AI users interact with one side of the tech’s story, but the enablers—the ones building the backstage infrastructure technology and hardware—are equally valuable.

value.title: Will artificial intelligence change how entertainment is made? | The Ethical Life podcast
value.excerpt: The hosts discuss how worried we should be about computers taking over more of what we watch and read, and whether live performances and sports will benefit.

value.title: OPINION: From principles to laws: Consumer protection can galvanize AI regulation

value.title: Empowering AI To Serve Humanity: Outcome-Driven, Ethical Innovation
value.excerpt: Ethical innovation in AI is a business objective and moral duty. Jobs-to-be-Done empowers businesses to ethically innovate and put human needs at the forefront.

value.title: DALL-E 3 could take AI image generation to the next level
value.excerpt: An anonymous leaker who claims to have been a part of an alpha test of Dall-E 3 for several months details features of the new version of the AI image generator.

value.title: The Debate Around AI Ethics in Australia is Falling Far Behind
value.excerpt: In Australia and elsewhere, the debate around AI and ethics rages. Meanwhile, AI apps with questionable ethics are being released daily.

value.title: What Europe's AI regulation moment will mean for the world
value.excerpt: AI's regulation 'moment' that Bodgan-Martin heralded in July will last for years and be an exercise in international legal coordination. It best be comprehensive and careful to ensure the power of AI is deployed for the good of humanity.

value.title: Entertainment companies hiring AI specialists amid Hollywood strike
value.excerpt: Actors have expressed fears about AI being used to replicate an actor’s image and likeness without the actor’s consent, while writers have pushed for limits on the use of AI to write or rewrite scripts.

value.title: HackerOne: How Artificial Intelligence Is Changing Cyber Threats and Ethical Hacking
value.excerpt: Security experts from HackerOne and beyond weigh in on malicious prompt engineering and other attacks that could strike through LLMs.

value.title: Netflix criticized for posting AI jobs paying up to $900,000 while writers and actors are on strike
value.excerpt: Amazon, Disney and Sony are also posting several AI-related positions paying six-figure salaries, even as the Writers Guild of America strike continues

value.title: Announcing the AI Stage agenda at TechCrunch Disrupt 2023
value.excerpt: AI is everywhere it seems, and you’ll find plenty of hot topics on the agenda for the new AI Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2023. Check it out!

value.title: More Battlefield AI Will Make the Fog of War More Deadly
value.excerpt: The Pentagon’s embrace of military AI raises questions about what limits should be placed on the technology—and how to keep humans in control.

value.title: Medical students recognize AI's potential in medicine, call for ethical education
value.excerpt: A team of researchers assessed medical students' understanding, perceptions, and educational preferences related to artificial intelligence.

value.title: Studios Quietly Go On Hiring Spree for AI Specialist Jobs Amid Picket Line Anxiety
value.excerpt: Netflix is hiring a $900,000 per year AI product manager, Disney is looking for generative AI specialists, and Sony seeks an AI ethics expert, while the tech becomes a staple of SAG-AFTRA and Writers Guild picket signs.

value.title: AI in sales and marketing: It’s here
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence is improving employee experience and productivity in fields such as sales, marketing and customer service.

value.title: AI tools pose threat to research ethics
value.excerpt: Among the various impediments to the integrity and sanctity of academic research perhaps the most perilous as well as unprecedented challenge is the emergence of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools like ChatGPT.

value.title: AI Governance Maturity Index: A Comprehensive Assessment Framework
value.excerpt: There are 5 broad levels of AI Governance Maturity that an organization may adopt. Each comes with key tradeoffs between speed of development, and risk mitigation, as well as costs to implement. value.title: Graft is building an AI development platform for the masses
value.excerpt: Graft is attempting to take the complexity out of building AI applications with a templatized approach to development.

value.title: How Does Artificial Intelligence Create New Jobs?
value.excerpt: While AI may reduce the demand for some jobs, it can also create new employment opportunities in previously unexplored areas.

value.title: AI appears more human on social media than actual humans: study
value.excerpt: An artificial intelligence study published in Science Advances found that AI-generated text on social media can appear more human than human-generated content.

value.title: State of IT report: Generative AI will soon go mainstream, say 9 out of 10 IT leaders
value.excerpt: Generative AI has only recently become mainstream. The report shows 86% of IT leaders believe generative AI will have a prominent role it their organization in the near future. Yet 64% of IT leaders are concerned about the ethics of generative AI, and 62% are concerned about its impacts on their careers.

value.title: Utopia Or Dystopia? It’s Up To Us To Teach AI To Reflect The Best Of Humanity

value.title: Hype, Fright And Ethics In Implementing AI
value.excerpt: Greater knowledge of what an AI is doing will help a lot in making sure that we understand what is possible with AI and that will help us use AI in ethical ways.

value.title: Sarah Silverman vs. AI: A new punchline in the battle for ethical digital frontiers
value.excerpt: Generative AI is no laughing matter. Every company that touches consumer data needs to develop and enforce an ethical use policy for gen AI.

value.title: UN security council delegates urge AI controls to defuse potential global threat
value.excerpt: The United Nations supports calls for a separate UN entity to facilitate collective efforts to govern artificial intelligence.

value.title: AI Economics Must Avoid The Ethical Mistakes Of Climate Economics
value.excerpt: There is increased danger that AI economics research will turn into a tool to advance a preset policy agenda, similar to what has played out in climate change economics.

value.title: Risks Associated With Off-The-Shelf AI Tools—And How To Mitigate Them
value.excerpt: In the wrong hands, they could turn into highly potent sources of malicious code—code designed to harm the software or enable security breaches. Employees using generative AI tools could unwittingly make their companies vulnerable to bad actors looking to generate malicious code.
